One of my favorite features is how a new game starts up immediately after you die. No having to press a button to start a new game. Makes it hard to stop sometimes...

38347206.review:
Gunlock is a simple single screen arcade style scoreathon, featuring an en vogue Game Boy™ pixel art style and pallet. 

Evocative of arcade and home console video games of the 80s, the action takes place in a arena that wraps at the edges with the goal to either kill or be killed. Your performance in Gunlock is measured by combo multipliers and total score. Progression is made by defeating bosses to unlock further arenas and by collecting dropped nuggets. Nuggets are then spent on further weapons and colour pallets. I did not enjoy all of the guns available and found myself selecting my favorite 3, but this does give you the option choosing how you want to play and is a welcome option.

The mechanics of the game are explained well enough in a brief tutorial level and can be expressed with a keyboard and mouse or controller. Having tried both control options I found that unsurprisingly I was more accurate with a mouse than a analog stick or steam controller touch pad. The action felt tangible enough through the controls that any failure felt like it was my fault rather than any fault of my controls. 

The enemies come at you in waves, getting progressively trickier but also fair as you advance. I felt like each enemy was teaching me something about the game and its mechanics or at least reminding me. Once you have dispatched with enough foes the arena boss makes an appearance to give you a final exam, and can take a few tries to master.

The art style is very well realised but distracting at times. I found myself not noticing enemies due to the colour pallet on occasion. However once I had locked in a zen state with the game this ceased to be an issue. I can appreciate why the game has the art style it has, and if had one thing I could say to the developer it would be to carry on with the pixel art style because you clearly have developed a talent for it, but I would like to see more colour in future titles.

The sound design and music is fitting for the aesthetic, featuring 8bit tones and noise layered with the odd wild west whistle. I enjoyed the sound and music, it feels appropriate for the action happening on screen. There is a lack of sound from the enemies (unless I just didn’t notice) but I feel this may have been overkill, as the game strikes a nice balance between gunfire and music.

I really enjoy Gunlock, it's a great game to  easily spend a few rounds or an hour on. It requires no investment from the player other than the development of your ability to improve and reach higher scores. While there are a few minor things that nagged me about the game overall I would recommend this game and say that it is worth your time and money, especially if you enjoy polished retro style arcade games.

38322995.review: Fun score-chasing game at a budget cost. Fast-paced, works well, nothing bad to say.

38294691.review:
Video Review: https://youtu.be/kBW4pB1MqZ4

I'm having a great time playing Gunlock. It has a good amount of enemy variety and even though the game has only three levels none of the enemies are recycled. That means each level is completely different. I think a lot of games take the easy route and reuse enemies to "expand" a game but it gets old. In Gunlock there are no worries about that and plenty of reasons to keep playing to get the high score.

Other review saying 18min, are you joking!? I put over four hours into this game and I could still keep playing. New guns and color pallets are purchasable with found gold. Some of these guns completely change how you play.

It's a distillation of arena combat in their own style. It's pure arcade fun with none of the extras.

38235516.review: Fun little time waster! Excellent for just picking up for a couple minutes at a time, just as the description states!

Really fun skill shooter with 3 levels in which the goal is to get the highest score that you can and beat others on the leaderboards, there's an in-game shop which you could buy different weapons & color palettes.

I was gifted this and honestly I'm really glad I got it, I'd easily buy more like this or even some kind of level dlc

The price is great for the amount of fun imo, takes a bit of skill but easy if you're using a controller with two triggers & the analog stick

38148309.review:
[b] Gunlock [/b] may seem like a generic high-score game but it is tons of fun. It has tight controls, lots of weapons, 3 infinite stages, achievements, and leaderboards. Although the recoil on guns may take some time to adjust. The only small thing that bothers me is that enemies tend to blend into the background. Otherwise, I do like the aesthetic and energetic music. In fact, I don't even mind dying in this game because how fast eveything is.

There are 2 small details that made Gunlock above average in this genre. You can customize which random weapons will spawn but you must have a minimum of 3. However, you do have to unlock them in the store first so there is some progression. Having a loadout choice adds a little bit of personal playstyle which I really appreciate. Also, you can buy color tones that will completely change the aesthetic. I only know of 2 other games that do that and I just love the feature.

The difficulty to unlock all stages is not very high. It should take you maybe 45 minutes to beat all bosses and about 2 hours to unlock all weapons. After that, you will have to rely on leaderboards for replay value. 

[h1] Final Thoughts 7/10 [/h1]

Even if you don't like grinding leaderboards Gunlock will be fun at least until you get all the guns. Very great price for how much fun I had. Something familiar about the character though ;)

38146819.review:
Little arcadey gem with a fantastic soundtrack and a nice look.

The gameplay's fun, quick, and fluid with Meat Boy-esque fast restarts for the many deaths you'll probably have across the three endless levels.  Definitely a game to pick up and easily lose track of time trying to top your own score.

It's literally the price of a candybar.

38145935.review: Addictive gameplay. Cool art. Badass soundtrack. This game offers a lot of replayability and fun at a great price. Give Gunlock a shot!

38145649.review: Got it for a buck and change.  Pretty fun and challenging.  Control scheme is a little wonky and the controls are a bit floaty but it's pretty fun to be honest.  Has that "one more run" kinda feel to it. Plus the musiic is pretty rad.  Gotta love them bleep-bloops!

38142055.review:
Addictive gameplay and great music! Didn't realize a game for this little can have so much content and amusement... also things to unlock! Everytime I thought I was going to quit, I kept deciding to play another round and try to get a higher score, or unlock another level.

It's a blast!

38141098.review: This game is super addictive, I can see myself sinking a lot of time into it. Great cost per enjoyment ratio on this little gem.

38140059.review:
Great solid fun arcade game from the genius mind behind Unworthy. 
Engaging gameplay, great art, lots of content and more for only the price of a beer.

38139683.review: A really fun and addicting game for the price! I still haven't killed the first boss... Must try again!

38138425.review: A fun and quick to pick up and play style game. Where you are put up against a gaunlet of enemies. Until a boss, survive the boss, kill em'. Enuff' Said. A bargin for under two dollars.

38138310.review: I'm a little biased; I wrote the music for Gunlock and I also playtested it quite a bit! Still, after all that, booting it up on release day I find the game to be surprisingly addictive and loads of fun! Plus there's a couple big game changing secrets that mix it up quite a bit if you keep playing! Have fun!

38136809.review:
XBOX Oneコントローラーを使用。

[u]ゲームボーイ風のグラフィックが特徴のアーケード系2Dアクションシューター。ストーリーは無いが、スコアアタック等を楽しむタイプのゲーム。[/u]

[h1][b]良い点[/b][/h1]

・操作はシンプルでとっつき易いものになっている。移動、ジャンプ、二段ジャンプ、壁ジャンプと撃つのみ。敵を倒すごとに画面右下のゲージが溜まっていき、最大になるとボス戦になる。ボスを倒すことが出来れば次のステージが解放される。ただ、今作の主人公は敵の攻撃を一発でも貰ってしまうと倒されるので注意が必要だ。

・ステージ開始時に所持（解放）している武器の中からランダムで一つ選ばれたものを使うことになるが、ステージ中に落ちている弾薬を拾うとこれもまたランダムで使用している武器が変わってしまう。同じ武器を使用し続けたい場合は敵をジャンプで踏みつけて倒すと現在使用中の武器の弾薬が回復される。ただし、上記したように今作は一度でも敵の攻撃をもらってしまうと終わりなので、少々リスクがある。

・ボスを倒しても終わりではなく、ステージが続いていく。スコアアタックが捗る。

・リトライが早くてストレスが溜まらない。ロード等は一切入らない。

・盛り上がるBGM。

・メニュー画面にあるショップからステージ内で入手できる通貨を使用して武器と画面のカラーパターンのアンロックができるようになっている。どちらも種類は豊富でアンロックしていくのがなかなか楽しい。

[h1][b]悪い点[/b][/h1]

・今後追加されるのかは不明だが、現状ではステージの総数が少ない。

・ショップ画面で売られている武器の名称が恐ろしく読み辛い。ゲームボーイ風のグラなので仕様が無いと言えばそうだが。

[h1][b]総評[/b][/h1]

今作はストアページの説明文通り、サクッとプレイできるので空いた時間にプレイするのに最適だ。色々なステージをプレイしたい方にはお勧めできないが、スコアを競うのが好きであればボリュームも気にならないだろう。

プレイ動画をアップしているので、気になった方は[u][url=https://youtu.be/l_0g9IagS28]こちら[/url][/u]を参考までにどうぞ。
